name: Parc Soleil by Hilton Grand Vacations Club

reviews.text: This was our 9th stay in Orlando and I cannot fault this place - the suites were spacious, well stocked and very much a home from home - so pleasant to spend time in during Tropical storm Debby!!!
reviews.title: Fabulous place to stay
Studio
reviews.text: The staff were lovely, nothing was too much trouble for them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is Palm Parkway, mid way between Crossroads/ Downtown Disney area & I Drive/ Dr Phillips area, around 5 mins drive in either direction.
reviews.title: Would love to come back!

reviews.text: Views of Seaworld fireworks from one direction and Disney across the lake in the other
reviews.title: Perfect Orlando holiday hotel

reviews.text: Seems as though there are plans to build further towers on site (currently only 2), but the grounds are well kept, acommodating a lake, tennis courts and bbq's for guest use located around the area.
reviews.title: Fabulous place, great value!

reviews.text: This was probably my 15th stay in the Orlando area over the last 20 years.(2 boys both teenagers) I came up from southwest florida for a 3 night stay. This is one of the newer Hilton brand time shares. Yes, it is about 3 yrs old and still has that newness about it. Rooms are spacious and provide views of the area, The property sits on an undeveloped area of land off of Interstate 4 .You are about 15-20 minutes from Disney, about 10-15 minutes from Downtown Disney. Hotel has a couple of pools, great for small children.OK, let me hit the negatives since I have stayed at probably 10 to 15 other hotels in this vicinity. The linens were dirty,pillowcases and sheets had lots of hair on them. Rooms were large but I felt not well decorated. Hotel in general was sort of generic in appearance. Pool areas large and attractive but the large pool was dirty (lots of dirt and objects on pool floor). The access road into hotel poorly planned and narrow. Dont bring a mid to full size suv to the parking garage, again poorly planned and only limited spaces available in which to park one. They do have a great kids program for the younger ages(up to 10) . I think this is great if you need the space (large family) . There are so many nicer choices that offer more convenience ,amenities, and a better atmosphere within a 5 mile radius of this property.
reviews.title: Nice,but not quite Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lastly, I am a hilton honors member and really like their resorts. Maybe my previous stays at some of their resorts has spoiled me a bit.
reviews.title: Great Property-Great Staff

reviews.text: The Hilton Corporation really knocked it out of the park with this place. The entire facility was awesome. The staff was great and the amenities were second to none. I enjoyed everything about staying here. I highly recommed this property.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property at a Great Price

reviews.text: We recently stayed in a 1 bedroom at the Parc Soleil for 3 nights. The rooms are spacious and beautiful. We had a view of the Magic Kingdom and could see the fireworks at night in the distance. The pools and hot tubs are great. They have a gym with all the newest equipment which we enjoyed using. There is a nice store on site that also serves food and beverages which was good. We did try the restaurant and bar and that was OK but overpriced. One of the drawbacks of the property is that it is located in an area with nothing else around. There were some condo projects that were stopped and old signs are all that is there. Also Hilton has only 2 towers up and several more that were planned but are not going up. So you're kind of in the middle of unfinished construction. You can't walk to anything and there's no shuttle or bus service so you definitely need a car. The resort is only about 10 minutes to Disney to the south and about 10 minutes from Sand Lake Rd with all the great restaurants to the north. There's even a Wal-Mart within 5 minutes to the north. Another drawback is that sometimes the maids do not come to the room until 5:00 pm or later. This can be inconvenient when you're trying to get ready for dinner. The price we paid was $95.00 a night and we upgraded to a one bedroom with our Hilton honors points. We felt the price was very reasonable for the amenities and quality of the property. A much better deal than any of the Disney hotels. I would stay here again for the price and don't think you'll be disappointed if you stay at this beautiful resort.
reviews.title: We heard the angels sing when we drove up.

reviews.text: BEAUTIFUL place. From the drive up check in to the staff to the entire place.
reviews.title: must go if you have young kids!

reviews.text: There are many choices for Orlando. This has poor value, mediocre front desk service, average pool for the area, and average food quality.
reviews.title: With all the choices around- it only deserves a 3

reviews.text: We stayed for a week (July 22-30) and have virtually nothing bad to say. The property is very well kept. The pool area is large and was not crowded at all. The hotel was easy driving distance (15 minutes max) to Universal, Disney World and Sea World. They had daily activities for kids as well as adults (wine/beer tasting, trivia, kareoke, Wii, blackjack, etc.).
reviews.title: Wonderful Property

reviews.text: The rooms were spacious and clean. The beds were a little soft for my taste, but the family slept comfortably. The free wi-fi worked just fine. The kitchen was well-equiped (I would recommend buying groceries and making as many meals as possible at the hotel).
reviews.title: Luxurious, Great Place.

reviews.text: The staff was very accomodating and quick to respond. Towels and shampoo were delivered less than 15 minutes after they were requested. Everyone from the desk clerk to the maintenence workers were friendly with a wave and a smile.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay in orlando

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is the parking. There aren't enough stalls to accomodate the number of cars. If I wasn't back to my room by 8:00 I had to park on the opposite side of the complex. One night I timed it and it was a five minute walk back to my room.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds...with some issues

reviews.text: Let me temper by saying we have stayed on Disney properties over 30 times.
reviews.title: Parc Soleil Hiton Excellent!

reviews.text: We had a great time at Parc Soleil. We enjoyed the cabana as owners of Hilton.
reviews.title: Awesome 4th of July Getaway
Beware of the "Stay A Night On Us" voucher policy.
reviews.text: We brought guests with us and they had a BALL !!

reviews.title: Great for kids
reviews.text: The complaints I have with Parc Soleil is :
1) Parking Garage parking spaces are tooo small !!
reviews.title: The Best Place to Stay for Us
Loved it so much we bought!
reviews.text: 2) Internet connection is HORRIBLE. Parc Soleil needs a bigger server. Never had any problems with internet connections at the HGVC Seaworld or Tuscany.

aka: Parc Soleil By Hilton Grand Vacations Club Hotel
description: Located on 52 acres in the heart of the attractions area in Orlando, Parc Soleil Suites by Hilton Grand Vacations is in close proximity to famous local attractions including Walt Disney World®, Universal Orlando®, SeaWorld® Orlando, Aquatica®, and is convenient to I-4 and more than 94 championship golf courses. Parc Soleil Suites features stylish studios and roomy one and two bedroom suites with balconies.
